level.description: This control ECM enables to modify the building/district energy consumption by changing the scheduling of heating systems with respect to the baseline. Modification in the usage of heating systems and boilers include start and stop time as well as zone temperature set-points.

level.application: Update in scheduling of boilers, CHP, heat pumps and related components such as baseboard.
level.advantages: Enables to quickly implement changes in the usage of building HVAC systems based on available information on building usage and occupants comfort.
level.disadvantages: The ECM does not exploit relevant information such as building heating / cooling time and outdoor temperature, which could be useful to improve relevant DPIs related to energy consumption, energy cost and occupants comfort.
level.links_to_barriers: This control ECM implementation requires hardware (such as timer, smart thermostat or BMS) and measurement system (temperature sensers)
level.installation_data: Installation must be performed according to the BEMS installation guidelines
level.maintenance_data: Maintenance must be performed according to the BEMS maintenance guidelines
